## x402 Payment Endpoint 

This workflow lets the operator monetize swaps from ERC-20 tokens to native gas tokens on up to 100 different EVM blockchains via the [Li.Fi](https://li.fi/) protocol. 

See the example curl command below for the proper payload configuration. 

Learn more about the [x402 payment](https://www.x402.org/) protocol. 

Watch the [YouTube tutorial]() video.

## Example Curl Command

You can test [1Shot Gas Station](https://github.com/uxlysoftware/1shot-gas-station?tab=readme-ov-file#1shot-api-gas-station) endpoint with a command like this (be sure to use a [properly formatted x-payment header](https://1shotapi.com/tools) payload: 

```sh
# swap out the URL here for you webhook URL endpoint
curl -X POST \
  https://n8n.1shotapi.dev/webhook-test/gas-station \
  -H "x-payment: YOUR-BASE64-ENCODED-PAYMENT-PAYLOAD" \
  -H "User-Agent: CustomUserAgent/1.0" \
  -H "Accept: application/json" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -d '{
    "fromChain": "43114",
    "fromToken": "0x9702230A8Ea53601f5cD2dc00fDBc13d4dF4A8c7",
    "fromAmount": "1000000",
    "fromAddress": "0x55680c6b69d598c0b42f93cd53dff3d20e069b5b",
    "toChain": "43114"
  }'
```

## Fetch Swap Route & Quote form Li.Fi

Use the input parameters to find a route and quote to convert the user's tokens into native gas tokens.

## Use 1Shot API to Simulate and Submit the Swap 

[1Shot API](https://1shotapi.com) handles simulating the transaction and submitting it the the appropriate blockchain network.

## Payment Configs

You must edit the "Lookup Payment Configs" node with the tokens you wish to support for swaps.

You need:

1. The token address
2. The EVM chain id
3. The token `name`
4. Token `version`
5. Import the 1Shot Gas Station `callDiamondWithEIP3009SignatureToNative` method into your 1Shot API business account and input its `contractMethodId`.
